trans-unit.source: Create ContentKeys with .NET
trans-unit.target: Create ContentKeys with .NET

trans-unit.source: Learn how to create content keys that provide secure access to Assets.
trans-unit.target: Learn how to create content keys that provide secure access to Assets.

trans-unit.source: Create ContentKeys with .NET
trans-unit.target: Create ContentKeys with .NET

trans-unit.source: Media Services enables you to create and deliver encrypted assets.
trans-unit.target: Media Services enables you to create and deliver encrypted assets.

trans-unit.source: A ContentKey provides secure access to your Assets.
trans-unit.target: A ContentKey provides secure access to your Assets.

trans-unit.source: When you create a new asset (for example, before you upload files, you can specify the following encryption options: StorageEncrypted, CommonEncryptionProtected, or EnvelopeEncryptionProtected.
trans-unit.target: When you create a new asset (for example, before you upload files, you can specify the following encryption options: StorageEncrypted, CommonEncryptionProtected, or EnvelopeEncryptionProtected.

trans-unit.source: When you deliver assets to your clients, you can configure for assets to be dynamically encrypted with one of the following two encryptions: DynamicEnvelopeEncryption or DynamicCommonEncryption.
trans-unit.target: When you deliver assets to your clients, you can configure for assets to be dynamically encrypted with one of the following two encryptions: DynamicEnvelopeEncryption or DynamicCommonEncryption.

trans-unit.source: Encrypted assets have to be associated with ContentKeys.
trans-unit.target: Encrypted assets have to be associated with ContentKeys.

trans-unit.source: This article describes how to create a content key.
trans-unit.target: This article describes how to create a content key.

trans-unit.source: When creating a new StorageEncrypted asset using the Media Services .NET SDK , the ContentKey is automatically created and linked with the asset.
trans-unit.target: When creating a new StorageEncrypted asset using the Media Services .NET SDK , the ContentKey is automatically created and linked with the asset.

trans-unit.source: ContentKeyType
trans-unit.target: ContentKeyType

trans-unit.source: One of the values that you must set when create a content key is the content key type.
trans-unit.target: One of the values that you must set when create a content key is the content key type.

trans-unit.source: Choose from one of the following values.
trans-unit.target: Choose from one of the following values.

trans-unit.source: <html></html><html></html>Create envelope type ContentKey
trans-unit.target: <html></html><html></html>Create envelope type ContentKey

trans-unit.source: The following code snippet creates a content key of the envelope encryption type.
trans-unit.target: The following code snippet creates a content key of the envelope encryption type.

trans-unit.source: It then associates the key with the specified asset.
trans-unit.target: It then associates the key with the specified asset.

trans-unit.source: call
trans-unit.target: call

trans-unit.source: <html></html><html></html>Create common type ContentKey
trans-unit.target: <html></html><html></html>Create common type ContentKey

trans-unit.source: The following code snippet creates a content key of the common encryption type.
trans-unit.target: The following code snippet creates a content key of the common encryption type.

trans-unit.source: It then associates the key with the specified asset.
trans-unit.target: It then associates the key with the specified asset.
